journal-title-group.journal-title: Theoria: A Journal of Social and Political Theory

title-group.article-title: The Art of Re-Interpretation: Michel de Certeau

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright © 2002 Faculty of Human and Management Sciences, University of Natal

ref.mixed-citation: Graham Ward (ed.), The Certeau Reader, Oxford, 2000;
François Dosse, Michel de Certeau: Le marcheur blessé, Paris, 2002, a book to which I had access only at the last moment.

Michel de Certeau uses the terms déplacement and transposition about the events of May 1968, La prise de parole, Paris, 1968, pp.45-6 (English transla- tion, The Capture of Speech and Other Political Writings, ed. by Luce Giard, Minneapolis, 1997, p.20).
Graham Ward on the "imprint" of the Jesuits on Certeau's writings: "The Voice of the Other", New Blackfriars, 1996, pp.518-28, at p.525.
Michel de Certeau, La culture au pluriel, Paris, 1974, pp.79, 106, 121, 187 (Eng- lish translation, Culture in the Plural, ed. by Luce Giard, Minneapolis, 1997, pp.33, 54, 67, 139).
Michel de Certeau, L'invention du quotidien, Paris, 1980 (English translation, 1984), pp.299ff;
Etudes, 1967;
Esprit, 1969.
"L'urgence de parler de quelque part, d'ancrer la parole en un lieu défini par un choix": Certeau, "Dom Helder", p.111.
